column4: Anyone know how to setup cups in gnome, or any special steps I need to do??
I didnt mean gnome, I meant Ubuntu, by default the cups web interface is deactivated, and I dont know how to activate it
farruin:  the cups web interface doesnt seem to be responding
What port is the cups web interface on? 631 right??
adduser cupsys shadow
that way you can login on the cups website
its not that I can login, its not responding
you get the login screen back?
or you dont get any website at all?
no, no login screen at all
you sure cupsys is installed?
and running?
cupsys    6408     1  0 20:22 ?        00:00:00 /usr/sbin/cupsd -F
yes a firewall could interfere with that, however I have no firewall rules up
you know what it was, I have never seen this before, but my loopback device wasnt setup properly
it is listening on 127.0.0.1
I fixed it
yup
good
Now its just a matter of straightening out my networking issues
I should just define my network interfaces in /etc/network/interfaces right??
and then those should be brought up wint /etc/init.d/networking right??
indeed
